content:
Illustrators are a type of body language that refers to gestures that are used to illustrate or emphasize the words that are being spoken. Some common examples of illustrators include:

1. Pointing: Pointing is a common illustrator that can be used to draw attention to a specific object or location.
2. Gesturing: People may use a variety of gestures to illustrate their words, such as by waving their hands or making a "thumbs up" sign.
3. Nodding: Nodding is a common illustrator that can be used to show agreement or understanding.
4. Shaking head: Shaking the head can be used to indicate disagreement or disbelief.
5. Facial expressions: Facial expressions, such as raising the eyebrows or smirking, can be used to illustrate the words that are being spoken.

Overall, illustrators are an important aspect of nonverbal communication and can help to convey the meaning of the words that are being spoken.
